Description: Gold finger-ring with a swivelling bezel of Egyptian style; round-sectioned hoop with tapering ends threaded through a hole in a gold bead then coiled around each other; the bead is crushed and damaged but may have once been shaped like a bull's head, details unclear; one side has two small wire loops, the other has an impressed design, possibly a bull's head with a rosette above.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (4)
